name: Dinner Tonight: Swordfish with Lemon Herb Butter
description: Who knew swordfish could be so delicious? I swear, every single time I've ordered it at a restaurant, it comes out dry and bland. For a while I wondered if that's just the way swordfish was supposed to taste. But cooking swordfish at home has been something of a revelation. It came out tender and succulent, and each bite was set over the top thanks to a little lemon herb butter, which I found in The Summer Shack Cookbook.
recipeIngredient: 3 sprigs fresh Italian parsley, stems removed, leaves chopped

recipeInstructions.text: For the lemon her butter: Add the paddle attachment to a stand mixer. Add the softened butter and turn on the mixer. Beat the butter until it is fluffy, about two minutes. Using a spatula, scrape down the sides of the bowl, and add the lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, parsley, chives, salt, and black pepper. Mix until well combined.

Transfer the butter to a piece of parchment paper or plastic wrap. Roll the butter into a “tight cylinder, about 1 ¼-inches thick. Twist the ends of the wrapping up, and then transfer the butter to the fridge.

For the swordfish: Add the one tablespoon of canola oil to a heavy-bottomed 12-inch stainless steel skillet set over medium high heat. Carefully add the swordfish steaks. Cook until well browned, about two minutes. Flip the steaks, and then brown on the other sides, about two minutes. Reduce the heat to low, and cook until steaks are completely cooked, eight to ten minutes.
Serve the steaks with about a tablespoon or so of the lemon herb butter. I also served this with a side of sauteed kale.
